messages.message: Hi, Brian! Of course, pleased to meet you. If you do not mind my asking, what made you reach out to me? I am fascinated by your education, background, and interests.
Your presentation on Data Exploration came up in my search. Interesting stuff.

Thank you! To be honest, I am a little embarrassed to have someone as tech savvy as you look at it. It was something I threw together for one of my professors, who was going to speak at an annual Safety Summit consisting mostly of production managers and safety specialists with a lot of data (some of it missing) and little sense for what to do with it. I tried to give them some hands-on advice for how to explore and visualize what they had, and while I was not there for the presentation, my professor said it was a success.

I am really interested in your work with Study Sauce--it sounds like a really interesting marriage of technology, education, and cognitive psychology. Can you tell me more about it?
I just got in to data science do not so tech savvy.
Cognitive psychology is right. 15 learning topics. I could send you an invite if you want, it would only take someone about 2 hours to complete the course.
I learned about accountability partners and setting short term goals.

Hey, Brian, sorry it has taken me awhile to get back to you: I was crazy busy last week, and my wife's birthday was over the weekend, so I took some time off. 

To tell you the truth, I am relatively new to data science myself. In my degree programs, we take several classes in data analytics and research and quantitative methods, but I have also been exploring it on my own to satisfy my own curiosity. Right now, my goal is to improve my fluency with R, but because I am taking a full load of classes, studying for our comprehensive exams, and doing two assistantships, I am usually only able to carve out a little bit of time each morning.

I would love to take a look, although it might take me awhile to complete it. This second to last semester of grad school is tough, but my summer should be considerably easier.
Happy birthday to the wifey! My wife's birthday was last weekend so we went to Love Beatles in Vegas.
